tool.name: AddDatasetConditionToSN
tool.displayname: Add Dataset Condition to Spatial Notification
tool.summary:
This GP tool adds a new dataset evaluator to a spatial notification, or adds a rule to an existing dataset evaluator for a spatial notification.

For more information about dataset evaluators and spatial notifications, please refer to the Workflow Manager user's guide. You may also wish to review the Workflow Manager Administrator's procedures for creating new spatial notification types, as the functionality provided by these GP tools is also available through those dialog boxes.
tool.usage:
• The default Workflow Manager database must be set before running this tool.

  • The user running this tool must have administrative access to the Workflow Manager database.

param.name: in_string_spatialNotification
param.dialogReference:
The name of the spatial notification to which the dataset condition will be added.

The domain for this parameter is populated based on the spatial notifications already present in the Workflow Manager database.
param.pythonReference:
The name of the spatial notification to which the dataset condition will be added.

The domain for this parameter is populated based on the spatial notifications already present in the Workflow Manager database.

param.name: in_string_dataWorkspace
param.dialogReference:
The name of the data workspace for which the dataset condition should be active.

The domain for this parameter is populated based on the names of the data workspaces present in the Workflow Manager database.
param.pythonReference:
The name of the data workspace for which the dataset condition should be active.

The domain for this parameter is populated based on the names of the data workspaces present in the Workflow Manager database.

param.name: in_fc_featureClass
param.dialogReference:
The feature class against which the dataset condition should operate.

NOTE: When choosing the feature class, you will need to use an .sde connection or database server connection that matches the data workspace selected in the previous parameter. This path/connection is *not* built automatically for you.
param.pythonReference:
The feature class against which the dataset condition should operate.

NOTE: When choosing the feature class, you will need to use an .sde connection or database server connection that matches the data workspace selected in the previous parameter. This path/connection is *not* built automatically for you.

param.name: in_string_changeCondition
param.displayname: Change condition (how/when to check the where clauses)
param.dialogReference:
A string indicating under which circumstances the "where" clauses should be checked.

The possible values for this parameter are as follows:

  • ALWAYS - Report a change whenever the conditions specified by the "where" clauses are met

  • CHANGED_FROM - Only report a change when a feature's values are changed away from the value(s) specified in the "where" clauses

  • CHANGED_TO - Only report a change when a feature's values are changed to the value(s) specified in the "where" clauses
param.pythonReference:
A string indicating under which circumstances the "where" clauses should be checked.

The possible values for this parameter are as follows:

  • ALWAYS - Report a change whenever the conditions specified by the "where" clauses are met

  • CHANGED_FROM - Only report a change when a feature's values are changed away from the value(s) specified in the "where" clauses

  • CHANGED_TO - Only report a change when a feature's values are changed to the value(s) specified in the "where" clauses

param.name: in_valueTable_whereClauses
param.dialogReference: Populate this table with any specific attributes/values from the selected feature class to be monitored as part of this dataset condition.
param.pythonReference: Populate this table with any specific attributes/values from the selected feature class to be monitored as part of this dataset condition.

param.name: in_bool_monitorAllFields
param.dialogReference:
Select this option to monitor any change to any of the fields in the named feature class.

When run from a script, the options for this parameter are:

  • MONITOR_ALL_COLUMNS / true - Watches all attribute columns in the feature class for changes.

  • MONITOR_SELECTED_COLUMNS / false - Watches only the specified attribute columns in the feature class for changes.
param.pythonReference:
Select this option to monitor any change to any of the fields in the named feature class.

When run from a script, the options for this parameter are:

  • MONITOR_ALL_COLUMNS / true - Watches all attribute columns in the feature class for changes.

  • MONITOR_SELECTED_COLUMNS / false - Watches only the specified attribute columns in the feature class for changes.

param.name: in_field_columns
param.dialogReference: Select the individual columns in the feature class that you intend to monitor for changes.
param.pythonReference: Select the individual columns in the feature class that you intend to monitor for changes.

param.name: in_bool_tryExistingEvaluator
param.displayname: Use/add to an existing dataset evaluator, if one is available
param.dialogReference:
A single dataset evaluator can contain one or more dataset conditions; if this option is enabled, a new dataset condition will be added to the first dataset evaluator that is found for the specified spatial notification.

When running from a script, the options for this parameter are:

  • TRY_EXISTING_EVALUATOR / true - Adds a new dataset condition to the first existing dataset evaluator, if any exists. (If not, a new evaluator is created and added to the spatial notification.)

  • MAKE_NEW_EVALUATOR / false - Creates a new dataset evaluator and adds the dataset condition to that evaluator.
param.pythonReference:
A single dataset evaluator can contain one or more dataset conditions; if this option is enabled, a new dataset condition will be added to the first dataset evaluator that is found for the specified spatial notification.

When running from a script, the options for this parameter are:

  • TRY_EXISTING_EVALUATOR / true - Adds a new dataset condition to the first existing dataset evaluator, if any exists. (If not, a new evaluator is created and added to the spatial notification.)

  • MAKE_NEW_EVALUATOR / false - Creates a new dataset evaluator and adds the dataset condition to that evaluator.

param.name: in_string_wmxDatabaseAlias
param.dialogReference: An optional parameter specifying that this tool should run on some database other than the default Workflow Manager database. If left blank, the default Workflow Manager database will be used.
param.pythonReference: An optional parameter specifying that this tool should run on some database other than the default Workflow Manager database. If left blank, the default Workflow Manager database will be used.

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This GP tool adds a new dataset evaluator to a spatial notification, or adds a rule to an existing dataset evaluator for a spatial notification.

For more information about dataset evaluators and spatial notifications, please refer to the Workflow Manager user's guide. You may also wish to review the Workflow Manager Administrator's procedures for creating new spatial notification types, as the functionality provided by these GP tools is also available through those dialog boxes.
